metadata.title: CVE-2022-42927 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A same-origin policy violation could have allowed the theft of cross-originURL entries, leaking the result of a redirect, via`performance.getEntries()`. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 106,Firefox ESR < 102.4, and Thunderbird < 102.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
